name: Ibis Glasgow City Centre

reviews.text: cheap, cheerful, efficient check in and out. Vey clean, very comfy bed, good black out blinds and opening window and hot powerful shower. Not a glamour hotel but wasn't expecting it
reviews.title: does what it says on the tin

reviews.text: Job done for overnight stay in Glasgow for work
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.text: Fantastic well equipped rooms, immaculately clean bathroom and free wifi. Centrally located and near to all shopping. Definitely worth a try, especially when compared against some of the other hotels on a similar or higher price range.
reviews.title: Excellent price, good location but dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Ibis Glasgow - good location, no fancy, but budget accomodation. As usual we have been booking Ibis beeing anywhere just for one night, as this was a "safe" choice - standard throughout the world so one could be sure what to expect in terms of quality and service. This time we have been staying for one night, having our flight following evening. We wanted to leave our luggage in the hotel for 5 hours after check-out. We have been informed that we'd be additionally charged for each pcs of luggage. No info about that on Ibis/Accor web pages or anywhere else. It's a shame Ibis is charging for the service which traditionally is free in any hotel, was always free in all Acoor hotels and free even in the cheap backpackers hostels. They are not stating on the invoice that the charge is for "luggage storage", but "Shop VATable". So they are even ashamed themselves to state it clearly. They better increase room price than charge for something which traditionally is a free service to the guests.
reviews.title: Shock: guests charged for luggage storage and no info anywhere, even on their web page

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have seen new Ibis advert : "Ibis changing for better ..." - above is the evidence of a lie! What's next? Charging for towels? For toilet paper? Thank you, Ibis management.
reviews.title: Best for Budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed here a few times when I have been in Glasgow and I always pick it because of the location and its great value for money. It is a bit basic but you get what you pay for. I never tried the food so cannot comment on that
reviews.title: Good Value for Money

reviews.text: I spent 2 nights here. Ibis have done a good thing in updating their beds. The memory foam topper meant I had an incredibly good night's sleep, which is unusual for me, as I normally struggle to sleep in hotel beds. Breakfast was ok, and was served from 6.30am, which was perfect as I had to leave at 7am each day. Reception staff were lovely, especially the chap that works the night shift.
reviews.title: Incredibly comfy bed!

reviews.text: IBIS always surprises me with a quality just above the expectancy you would have based on their rates. This IBIS however delivers exactly that: basically ok but could do better on a number of fronts. Beds are hard (back ache in the morning), breakfast plenty-full but uninspiring for a continental breakfast. The staff is very helpful and friendly and the location is good: you can do Glasgow by walking around. Charging 2 GBP for attending the luggage (per item) on the day of departure is a new to me and not customer friendly.
reviews.title: Budget basic OK

reviews.text: I spent 3 nights here, 29/8-1/9 - The pluses first, decent location firstly, check in quick & fairly easy. The taxi pick-up arrangement is very good, and works so well.
reviews.title: Mediocre Hotel - A Few Real problems that spoiled an otherwise enjoyable stay!

reviews.text: The negatives, I arrived at my room 511, and it had a pretty bad smell, (no one likes the smell of sewage right?) - Anyway, opened window etc, then went out to met some friends. Came back, around midnight, and honestly, it was like sleeping in a cess pit, I lasted 30mins.. Got up went down to reception, asked to be changed rooms.... So, they changed me .. (but ask the question why was that not dealt with during the previous days cleaning rounds, is it really acceptable to allocate a room, with such a smell, when teh staff seemed aware of a plumbing problem?)
reviews.title: value for money

reviews.text: Great to be able to check in soon after we arrived in the early morning. The rooms were great, clean and comfortable. The location was excellent. I would stay here again. Beds were a little hard but comfortable. The desk and staff were helpful and informed. Good value for the money.
reviews.title: Great place, great visit.

reviews.text: This Hotel had the usual Ibis bathroom plastic pod in the corner of the room with a step up to get into it.
reviews.title: Not the best hotel I have stayed at or the worst..

reviews.text: Not ideal for the middle of the night use when bleary eyed and legs that are still half asleep or when you have had a drink.
reviews.title: Perfect For SECC

reviews.text: No hand towel or small soap bar just bath towels and they were rough.
reviews.title: Good value at great location

description: Ibis Glasgow hotel is centrally located, between the business and shopping district. Just 2 streets away is Glasgow's famous Sauchiehall Street which has a wide selection of shops,bars & restaurants. The Buchanan Galleries & Princess Square are also within walking distance. The SECC Exhibition and Convention Centre is only 20 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel is within easy reach of the M8 motorway, Queen Street, Charing Cross and Central Station and many more of the city's main attractions like Kelvingrove Art Gallery, Universities of Glasgow, Strathclyde and Caledonian, Kings Theatre, Pavillion Theatre, O2 Academy. Free wifi throughout the hotel. The hotel does not have a car park, however metered street parking is available which is free of charge after 6pm and before 8am. We also have a discount available for guests who use the City Car Park on Elmbank Street, £12 for 24 hours use. The hotel has a fully serviced bar and restaurant. Guests can choose from a cooked buffet breakfast, snacks available 24 hours per day or evening meals. Rooms are fully en-suite with walk in showers, tea/coffee making facilities, pay per view movies, mp3 connections and internet. Residents can also use the gym, sauna and steam room facilities in the Novotel next door for a small fee.
